text: i like roomba

text: yes. more roomba please

name: atticusonline
text: so begins an era...

name: theloneliestmonkey
text: Teodor's eyes make the strip.

name: havenless
text: I love how Beefs all dressed up in a tie to play Luke Skywalker on his robo vac.

name: ssddr
text: Well, its not like Teodor is really trying either, just a cape and a smug expression on him.

name: singtralala
text: dude, that expression is all darth vader.

name: ganymedeio
text: HELLA Darth.

name: tinhand
text: I'd like to think that it's actually possible to ride around on roomba vacs without crushing them, because the idea of acting and moving on little platforms is both cool and lame at the same time.

name: littlefatdog
text: A comment left by littlefatdog was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by blacksheepboy, anticitizen, mercuri0us, Johnnyrocker, St-Elmos_Fire)

text: stuffed bears and cats.

text: Stuffed bears who age when stuffed otters do not... and cats.

name: tombsgrave
text: A comment left by tombsgrave was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ted0phile, johnnybaverage, hargbarf, quinine, tttt2, StagnantDisplay, atticusonline, Zem, yingkaixing, Panserbjorne, sumisueme)

name: gormster
text: Ahahaha... that one made me LOL IRL.

name: utv
text: Come on guys, don't lame tombsgrave. This is actually relevant.

name: never_die
text: The strip that started a legend.

name: patkun
text: Teador is the best Darth Vader ever. Look at that face of pure evil.

name: skiddysmith
text: AGREE!

name: plusigot125
text: Can anyone explain to me the essential gist of Teodor's character? I've never really understood how the little guy's mind works. Obviously this is a relative question, as the Achewood characters all act somewhat inscrutably at least some of the time.

name: relaxing
text:
Boy, did Onstad answer that one for you!
http://achewood.com/index.php?date=08292007

You may be slightly too young to really remember the "Generation X"/slacker archetype, but I think it fits Teodor pretty well.

name: peterjoel
text: A comment left by peterjoel was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by johnnybaverage, Cyberbob, mercuri0us)

name: troy_convers
text: 'Left over'? You mean just like Lyle, Phillipe, Cornelius and Todd  as well?

name: drycup
text: I guess the decided against the lightsabers in the end.  Probably a health hazard on roombas.  Could be another accidental Beef death.

name: dasilodavi
text: This starts a bizarre trend in strips.  I shall lend this on a five, but all others will subsequently fall victim to a negative point creep.

name: drvonkill
text: How is this not in the highest rated strips? Beef's tiny "nooo" as he roomba's away is pure comedy gold.

name: wurlitzergirl
text: Amen.

name: mindbnder
text: what amuses me is the obvious implication that they have been planing on doing something like this for a long, long time.

name: tbtabby
text: These Roomba Theater comics make me wish I had a Roomba...and that it could support my weight.

name: eatmorekix
text: the roomba was also featured in arrested development, to a hilarious end.

name: canusdivinus
text: I like Beef's response better than Hammill's.

name: jezebel
text: We call our terrier a Roomba- the Pro Elite model.

text:

Teodors costume is not the worst evidently

name: wurlitzergirl
text: Possibly one of my favorites. That. Last. Panel.

text: I like the fact that the first films they make after getting a second roomba is one in which only one of the roombas actually moves anyway.

name: arelladawn
text: I just got RB tattooed on my arm from this strip. It means that much to me.
